comments.author: Marina@Picnic at Marina
comments.content:
Hi Michael, that pasta attachment is so cool, I am looking into buying one in addition to my pasta roller attachment, that is heavily used in my kitchen.  I wish Kitchen Aid send me something to test too! :) 
Anyway, your rigatoni looks fantastic all spiced up in smoked paprika. Michael, forgive me my culinary illiteracy but what vodka does in sauces? I understand adding wine or  liqueur to enhance the flavor. But vodka? Alcohol evaporates during heating, and what is left from vodka after?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Good question! The theory (and I haven't done a side-by-side to test) is that alcohol can extract some flavor compounds from the other ingredients that aren't easily dissolved in either fat or water, before evaporating itself. It would be well worth doing a controlled experiment to see if this has any validity.

comments.author: Marina@Picnic at Marina
comments.content: Thanks Michael! I didn't do side-by-side test either in cooking, but I tasted tomato sauce with vodka and a regular one, same brand, and I didn't taste a difference. I am intrigued now... :)

comments.author: Stephanie, The Recipe Renovator
comments.content: Hey, I will definitely be renovating this recipe... love the inspiration. It's my understanding that alcohol does not completely cook off, so people allergic to alcohol, or people who are sensitive to it (i.e. alcoholics) should avoid cooking with it at all. I definitely can taste the flavor of the vodka in vodka sauce. Plus, I love saying Wodka. And, Mockba.

comments.author: Vegetarian
comments.content: I love rigatoni and I learned making it from an Italian friend of mine. We add prawns into the dish but I like your idea better of using veggies as substitute.

comments.author: Monica
comments.content: Had to comment on this one! I've made this every other week since I discovered your website a few months back. Thanks for the great recipe, its given me the courage to try some of your other recipes that I would have never thought to try!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: That is so nice to hear, Monica!

comments.author: Jackie
